ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] JM Capozi
ygData.msgSnippet: Ok, so which shop? I m gonna be there this weekend for the afr (alt.fairs.renaissance) invasion.  I ll prolly be in the kilt, if you look at the pic s. I d
ygData.messageBody:
Ok, so which shop?
I'm gonna be there this weekend for the afr (alt.fairs.renaissance)
invasion. I'll prolly be in the kilt, if you look at the pic's.
I'd like to actually meet a fellow bard :)

And Evulia,
No, I didn't win the contest...
E.J., the shaman got 1st place, and the Troll got 2nd. They get custom
art of their characters done for winning.

Talies, I was in EK as a bard at 16...if you go down by the shore, past
the bridge from runnyeye, (around -1000 to -2000) you can pull single
gnolls and kite them up and down the shore...but if you get any adds,
head for the bridge and zone...

At 18, I learned the 2 instrument/3 song twist here, fighting 2-4 gnolls
at a time. It's easy xp then...

After
Mac

Donny Dane
ddane01@...
ddane@...
www.arrow-computing.com


> -----Original Message-----
> From: Talies the Wanderer [mailto:snicker@...]
> Sent: Tuesday, November 06, 2001 12:16 PM
> To: eqbards@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: RE: [eqbards] JM Capozi
>
> At 11:52 AM 11/6/2001 -0600, you wrote:
> >Ok, so where the **** were you?
> >I was the bard, in lambent, in the costume contest...
>
> Like I said, you missed me ;)
>
> I was working at the Faire, as I always do. This year, I'm mostly in
a
> shop, but at noon, I was giving the hat-stand vendor in Sherwood
Forest a
> break. That's when a nice young lady came up and asked me where the
EQ
> meeting was, so I led her there. I got to see everyone in line for
food,
> then had to get back to work. *sighs*
> At least I'm making good money.
>
> Back to EQ-related questions:
>
> Do you think a Bard can survive in EK at 16? Solo?
>
> Talies
>
>
>
